intro: Pilosella exacuta, commonly known as the sharpleaf pincushion, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as meadows and grasslands. Its leaves are sharply pointed and covered in fine hairs, giving it a distinctive appearance. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months.
